content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

Here's how you can do it:

```julia
function find(arr)
    sort!(arr)
    len = length(arr)
    if len % 2 == 0
        return (arr[len/2]+arr[len/2+1])/2.0
    else
        return arr[div(len,2)+1]
    end
end

# Example usage:
arr = [12, 11, 13, 14, 15, 5, 6]
println("Median of the given array: ", find(arr))
```

This function sorts the input array and then computes the median. If the length of the array is even, it calculates the average of the two middle elements as the median. Otherwise, it returns the middle element (since there's only one in this case).
